info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 4:43PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Mecklenburg and eastern Gaston Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Gastonia, or near Mt Holly, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, Gastonia, Central Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, East Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Mt Holly, Belmont, Cramerton and Lowell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
